title: Integrate with OPTIC Data Lake
content:
OPTIC Data Lake (OPTIC DL) provides a central data lake to receive, process, and store data that is high in volume and velocity from several independent data sources. With this integration, historical record data of SMAX can be populated to OPTIC Data Lake based on a backend job. Then, the SMAX data can be represented in a holistic view along with data from other data sources through reporting tools (such as UIF dashboard and Flex reporting) or any other third-party BI tools to generate meaningful analysis.

About this integration:

  • This integration requires the tenant to have a Premium license. 
  • Historical record data will be populated to OPTIC Data Lake, which means every time an update is made on a record, a new record is created in OPTIC Data Lake. If you want to populate an existing record, you need to make an update on it.
  • If the integration is deactivated and then activated again, the updates made during this period of time will not be pushed to OPTIC Data Lake.
  • The backend data push job runs every 15 minutes and pushes 1,000 updates each time. The updates that weren't onboard will be handled next time the job is running. Therefore, the maximum number of updates that can be pushed per day is 96,000 (per tenant).
  • Data that failed to be populated will be kept for up to 1 week and then be retired.
  • Each configured record type needs a corresponding table in OPTIC Data Lake. Therefore, whenever you add a new record type to the OPTIC Data Lake integration configuration, you need to click the Apply button to create corresponding tables in OPTIC Data Lake before the data population.
  • New custom fields will be added as columns in corresponding tables in OPTIC Data Lake right after it is saved in Service Management Studio. However, deleted custom fields won't be removed from corresponding tables in OPTIC Data Lake.
  • Only EMS record types are supported, including custom applications.
  • The following logic types of fields are not supported: IMAGE, LARGE_TEXT, RICH_TEXT, and COMPLEXT_TYPE.
  • For demo or testing purposes, you may try "mass update" on existing records, and then you will see data being populated into OPTIC Data Lake.

Prerequisites of this integration

Before integrating SMAX with OPTIC Data Lake, be aware of the following prerequisites.

Application information

OPTIC Data Lake is only available as a capability along with the application container: AI Operations Management, NOM, and DCA. To enable this integration, you need an existing OPTIC Data Lake already deployed with other applications. To prepare the configuration, you need to get the following information from the existing OPTIC Data Lake deployment.

Throughout this topic, when giving examples, we use AI Operations Management as the application container of OPTIC Data Lake. 
Item Description
IdM endpoint URL of OPTIC Data Lake https://<externalAccessHost>:<Port>
Credentials of the OPTIC Data Lake user with two out-of-the-box roles: DI ADMIN and DI INGESTION Create a new user or prepare an existing user in the IdM of OPTIC Data Lake with DI ADMIN and DI INGESTION roles.
Administration URL of OPTIC Data Lake

h ttps://<externalAccessHost>:<Port>/itom-data-ingestion-administration
Data receiver URL of OPTIC Data Lake

https://<externalAccessHost>:<Port>/itom-data-ingestion-receiver

This integration accesses the OPTIC Data Lake APIs and ingests data into OPTIC Data Lake. For details, see Prepare. Note that the "OPTIC DL Data Access" is not required by this integration.

Direct network connection

This integration requires a direct network connection, that is, the two endpoints (Service Management and the application that has OPTIC Data Lake deployed) must be in the same network domain. For example, they can be both on a public cloud platform or deployed on-premise in a private domain. Having one application on a public cloud platform and the other in a private domain is not supported.

Native SACM tasks

If you have Native SACM enabled for Service Management,you need to get the UD/UCMDB data synchronized with the RTSM data (for AI Operations Management) first to have the same UUID for one CI. Otherwise, you can simply correlate the CIs against the Display Label.

    Configure OPTIC Data Lake certificates

    To set up the integration, you need to import the OPTIC Data Lake certificates into Service Management.

    Download OPTIC Data Lake certificates

    Take https://<externalAccessHost>:443 as an example.

    Follow the below steps to get certificates:

    1. Visit https://<externalAccessHost>:443, click Not secure and Certificate is not valid.
    2. Go to the Details tab and select the root certificate, then click Export.

    If you want to use ports different from 443, you also need to import different certificates for them. For example, you have the following Administration and Data receiver URLs:

    • https://<externalAccessHost>:30004/itom-data-ingestion-administration
    • https://<externalAccessHost>:30001/itom-data-ingestion-receiver

    Follow the below steps to get certificates:

    1. Visit https://<externalAccessHost>:30004/, click Not secure and Certificate is not valid.
    2. Go to the Details tab and select the root certificate, then click Export.
    3. Visit https://<externalAccessHost>:30004/, click Not secure and Certificate is not valid.
    4. Go to the Details tab and select the root certificate, then click Export.

    Import OPTIC Data Lake certificates

    To import the certificate, refer to the section applicable to your deployment.

    Classic deployment

    Copy the certificates to the following directory on the NFS server of SMAX: <global-volume>/certificate/source. For example, /var/vols/itom/itsma/global-volume/certificate/source.

    Helm deployment

    To import the OPTIC Data Lake certificate into the application on a helm deployment, refer to the steps in Import CA certificate into the application.

    Restart pods

    Restart SMAX pods by running commands on a control plane node or the bastion node:

    1. Run the following commands to restart the SMAX platform pods. 
      kubectl rollout restart deployment -n itsma-xxxx itom-xruntime-platform
kubectl rollout restart deployment -n itsma-xxxx itom-xruntime-platform-offline
    2. Run the following command to restart the bo-ats pod. 
      kubectl rollout restart deployment -n itsma-xxxx itom-bo-ats-deployment

    Create a credential for OPTIC Data Lake

    To create a credential for OPTIC Data Lake, follow these steps:

    1. Log in to the application as admin: https://<external access host of SMAX>/bo.
    2. Click Configurations.
    3. On the Credential Store tab, click New.
    4. In the Credential dialog box, specify these fields:
      Field Description
      Name The display name of the required credential you want to create for the OPTIC DL IdM.
      Tenant

      The tenant ID, which is required when you add capabilities after installing the application.

      The tenant you select must be active.
      IdM endpoint The endpoint of the OPTIC DL IdM that you want to connect. For example, https://<externalAccessHost>:<Port>. 
      Organization The organization of the OPTIC DL IdM.
      User name

      The name of the IdM user with the DI ADMIN role and/or DI INGESTION role. 

      If you use one single IdM user for both the DI ADMIN role and the DI INGESTION role, you only need to create one credential. If you use two different users for the DI ADMIN role and the DI INGESTION role, make sure you create two credentials for each of them. You can only create or delete one credential at a time.
      Security type The security type. You can select either PASSWORD or VAULT.
      Password The password of the user. Enter the password if you selected PASSWORD as the security type.
      Vault The vault key. Enter the vault key if you selected VAULT as the security type.
    5. Click Test connection. If the action fails, check if the field values are correct.
    6. Click Save. It will generate a UUID for this credential. You can use this UUID to connect to the OPTIC DL IdM.

    Deploy the OPTIC Data Lake capability

    Follow these steps to deploy the OPTIC Data Lake capability for the tenant:

    1. Log in to the application as the admin: https://<external access host of SMAX>/bo.
    2. Click Tenants.
    3. Click and open the tenant for which you just created the credential.
    4. On the Capability settings tab, click Deploy new capability. 
    5. In the Pre-check step, in the Capability dropdown box, select OPTIC Data Lake. 
       Only when a Premium license has been added to the selected tenant, the OPTIC Data Lake option will appear in the dropdown box. 
    6. In Administration URL, enter  https://<externalAccessHost>:<port>/itom-data-ingestion-administration.
    7. In Credential for administration, select the credential you just created.
    8. Click Next.
    9. In the Config and deploy step, in Data receiver URL, enter  https://<externalAccessHost>:<port>/itom-data-ingestion-receiver.
    10. In Credential for data receiver, select the credential you just created.
    11. Check the acknowledge box. 
    12. Click Deploy.
    13. The deployment is now completed. Note that the OPTIC Data Lake capability can only be deployed once, however, you can change the configurations through the Capability settings tab later.

    Configure the integration

    Once the OPTIC Data Lake capability is deployed, the Service Management tenant admin or the Integration admin (People > Roles > On-Premise Bridge/Integration > Administrator) needs to configure the integration:

    1. Go to the agent interface.
    2. In Integration Management, select Integration configuration.
    3. Click and expand the OPTIC Data Lake node. 
    4. You can enable OPTIC Data Lake either for specific record types or for all supported record types. You can enable OPTIC Data Lake for specific record types. To do this, click Add, select the desired record type, and then click Save. Click Save in the main window, then click Apply. Once the record type is added, it will appear in the left-side pane. Alternatively, you can enable OPTIC Data Lake for all supported record types. To do this, check the Apply for all record types box, click Save, then click Apply. However, by enabling it for all supported record types, the data throughput might surge and impact the system's performance.
    5. Now, the SMAX metadata will be synchronized and the database structure will be created in OPTIC Data Lake.
      Note:  The COMPLEX_TYPE, IMAGE, LARGE_TEXT, and RICH_TEXT metadata is not supported and won't be synchronized.

    Data synchronization

    After the OPTIC Data Lake integration has been configured:

    • Any changes to the SMAX metadata will be synchronized to OPTIC Data Lake instantly. 
    • Any changes to the SMAX record data will be synchronized to OPTIC Data Lake every 15 minutes. Note that the maximum number of database transactions per job is 1000. 

    Notes:

    • When synchronizing data of the MULTI_LANG_TYPE logic type to OPTIC Data Lake, the English version will be synchronized regardless of the language of the environment. This is by design.
    • If some strings saved in Service Management are not in English and are not displayed properly in Vertica, you can change the font property settings of Vertica to resolve this issue.
    • The data synchronization is continuous. If the platform online or offline pods are restarted during this period of time, data loss may occur. Therefore, please make sure no synchronization is ongoing when you restart the pods.
    • Failed transaction context data will be synchronized later than newly created/updated data. 
    • When metadata created for an Enum/Enum_Set type is synchronized to OPTIC Data Lake, two columns will be created in the OPTIC Data Lake table, shown as <metadata name> and <metadata name>_display_label. 
    • If the OPTIC Data Lake has been enabled for a record and it has an ENTITY_LINK field, make sure its Reference to record type has also been added to the OPTIC-Data-Lake-integration.
    • Data of Many2Many relationships are saved in the smax_entity_relations table in OPTIC Data Lake.

    Verify the integration

    Once the data synchronization is done, you can browse SMAX data in OPTIC Data Lake.

    Database structure

    For each record type, there's a corresponding database table created in OPTIC Data Lake. The naming convention of database tables in OPTIC Data Lake is as follows:

    Convert the Service Management record type's name from camelcase to lowercase, connect the words with an underscore (_), and then append the prefix smax_entity_. Take the Service Management record type ActualService as an example, the corresponding table name in OPTIC Data Lake is smax_entity_actual_service.

    SMAX data

    The SMAX data is stored in the OPTIC Data Lake tables. The SMAX field names are converted to Vertica table columns by following the data model guidance of OPTIC Data Lake.

    • In general:
      • Convert the SMAX field's name from camelcase to lowercase and connect the words with an underscore (_).
      • Create two system columns, timestamp_utc_s and timestamp_tz for each record type.
    • For SACM record types (Device, ActualService, ServiceComppnent, and SystemElement), their GlobalId field is converted to cmdb_global_id.(cmdb_global_id).
    • For each Enum or EnumSet field, an additional column with the suffix display_label is created. Take the Priority field of Request as an example, an additional column called priority_display_label is created.
    • Fields of COMPLEX_TYPE, IMAGE, LARGE_TEXT, and RICH_TEXT logical types aren't supported in OPTIC Data Lake yet. Therefore, no columns are created for them.

    Use the integration

    After SMAX data has been populated to OPTIC Data Lake (deployed with AI Operations Management), based on your business needs, you can create your own reports with SMAX data.

    You can also get Service 360 Summary reports in the AI Operations Management reporting system. For details, see Deploy Service 360 Summary Flex reports.
